name: sales_db
description: A relational database designed to store comprehensive customer information and detailed records of their purchase activities. For example, it can track a customer's personal details and all their orders over time, enabling analysis of buying habits and customer value.

name: customer
description: This table stores personal and contact information for each customer. Each row represents a unique customer, including their full name, email, phone number, date of birth, and physical address. For example, a record might represent 'Jane Doe' with her email, phone, birthday, and home address.

name: customer_id
description: A unique string identifier assigned to each customer, used as the primary key for the customer table. Example: 'c8f1b2e3-4d5a-6f7b-8c9d-0e1f2a3b4c5d'.

name: customer_name
description: The full name of the customer as a string. Example: 'Alice Johnson'.

name: email_address
description: The customer's unique email address, used for communication and identification. Example: 'alice.johnson@example.com'.

name: contact_number
description: The customer's phone number, which may include country and area codes. Example: '+1-555-123-4567'.

name: date_of_birth
description: The customer's date of birth, stored in 'YYYY-MM-DD' format. Example: '1985-07-23'.

name: address
description: The full mailing address of the customer, including street, city, state, and postal code. Example: '123 Maple Street, Springfield, IL 62704'.

name: purchase
description: This table records every purchase made by customers. Each entry includes a unique purchase ID, a reference to the customer, product details, price, quantity, and the date and time of the transaction. For example, it can log that customer 'Alice Johnson' bought 2 'Wireless Mice' for $19.99 each on '2025-04-09 09:53:25'.

name: purchase_id
description: A unique string identifier for each purchase transaction. Example: 'p123e456-7b89-0c12-3d45-6e789f012345'.

name: customer_id
description: The unique identifier of the customer who made the purchase, referencing the 'customer_id' in the customer table. Example: 'c8f1b2e3-4d5a-6f7b-8c9d-0e1f2a3b4c5d'.

name: product_name
description: The name of the product purchased, such as 'Wireless Mouse', 'Bluetooth Headphones', or 'USB-C Charger'. Example: 'Smartwatch'.

name: price
description: The price per unit of the product at the time of purchase, stored as a decimal value. Example: 49.99.

name: quantity_purchased
description: The number of units of the product purchased in the transaction. Example: 3.

name: purchase_date
description: The exact date and time when the purchase was made, stored in 'YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS' format. Example: '2025-04-09 09:53:25'.
